column1: # Title: H2A energy input-output coefficients of hydrogen production technologies
# Units: Generally GJ in /kg H2 out
# Source: H2A is the DOE EERE Hydrogen program's analysis model (https://www.hydrogen.energy.gov/h2a_analysis.html). H2A 2018 (generally)
column2: Results tab (2008 for nuclear thermal splitting)

column1: # Comments: Non-energy cost = required selling price - feedstock costs. Max improvement = improvement_to_2040 + 10%

Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis.
Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis powered by solar PV created electricity. Efficiency is equivalent to central electrolysis.
Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis powered by solar wind created electricity.Efficiency is equivalent to central electrolysis.
2040 efficiency assumed to be the same as 2015. Equals the sum of electricity and thermal energy requirements (GJ). Source: H2A 2008.
Method of electrolysis utilized: PEM Electrolysis - Forecourt model for larger (1500kG/H2/day) plant.

Assume 100% process water consumption.  Total cooling water is calculated by subtracting from total WCF from Spath et al (2005) We then calculate the consumed fraction of cooling water by applying the consumption/withdrawal ratio from Mackinack et al for recirculating IGCC power plant

Assume 100% process water consumption.  Total cooling water is calculated by subtracting from total WCF from Spath et al (2005) We then calculate the consumed fraction of cooling water by applying the consumption/withdrawal ratio from Mackinack et al for recirculating IGCC power plant
Assume the fraction of cooling water that is consumed is equal to that of the recirculating gas (steam/CT) technology from electricity sector
Assume the fraction of cooling water that is consumed is equal to that of the recirculating gas (CC CCS) technology from electricity sector
